bib_record.title: Investigation of Cr-50(d,n)Mn-51 and Nat-Cr(p,x)Mn-51 processes with respect to the production of the positron emitter Mn-51.

MeV and some proton irradiations up to 22-MeV were
performed at the compact cyclotron CV-28. Proton
irradiations were done mostly at the injector of COSY

free_txt: The Specially shielded detector with very low
background.
Total errors of the calculated cross
sections were determined from the errors activity,
particle flux, and number of target nuclei per plane
using Gaussian propagation law.
The error of the detector efficiency
The resulting absolute activity error
The uncertainty of energy in separate foil
was  calculated  by  authors.  The formulae is given in
paper.
All deuteron irradiations up to 13.5-
MeV and some proton irradiations up to 22-MeV were
performed at the compact cyclotron CV-28. Proton
irradiations were done mostly at the injector of COSY
with proton energies up to 45 MeV.
The nominal beam current was 300 nA for
deuterons and less 200 nA in proton experiments.
At CV-28 Cyclotron
At injector cyclotron of COSY.
Isotopically enriched Cr-50, 94.7% in metallic form.
The isotopic composition was: Cr-50 94.7%, Cr-52 4.84%,
Cr-53 0.37%, Cr-54 0.09% for the natural Cr. The
chemical impurities, as specified by the Supplier were-
Ti< 30ppm, Mn <10 ppm, Fe <250 ppm, Ni < 40 ppm, Cu (80
ppm), Al (780 ppm), Si (200 ppm) and Ca (150 ppm).
Targets were prepared by electrodeposition of metallic
Cr-50 on gold cathodes. Metallic filings of Cr-50 were
converted almost quantitatively to pure Cr oxide.
The errors of the final deuteron fluxes 16%
The error of the number of target nuclei
The result for counting the 749.1-keV characteristic
photopeak.  Due to the very weak intensity of this
gamma-ray and due to its overlap with the 744.2 keV
gamma-line of Mn-52, the derived activities have a
high error.
The errors of the final deuteron fluxes 16%
The error of the number of target nuclei

nuclei were 10% and 6.5% in proton irradiations

photopeak.

- By Authors - The main contribution process to the
formation of Cr-48 are Cr-50(p,t) and Cr-50(p,2n+p).
Since the experimental reaction threshold lies above
26 MeV, the contribution of the (p,t) reaction
(threshold 15.4 MeV) is obviously small compared to
that of the (p,2n+p) reaction with threshold 24.1 MeV.
- By Compiler - Cr-48 production due to radioactive
decay of Mn-48 is not excluded at high energy.
The error of the number of target
nuclei were 10% and 6.5% in proton irradiations
at the CV 28 and COSY injector, respectively.
The error of the number of target
nuclei were 10% and 6.5% in proton irradiations
at the CV 28 and COSY injector, respectively.
The error of the number of target
nuclei were 10% and 6.5% in proton irradiations
at the CV 28 and COSY injector, respectively.
- By Authors - Cr-51 is mainly formed by the
Cr-52(p,p+n)Cr-51 reaction, but also by Mn-51 decay
after Cr-52(P,2N) reaction.
The error of the number of target
nuclei were 10% and 6.5% in proton irradiations
at the CV 28 and COSY injector, respectively.
- By Authors - V-48 is formed mainly via the
Cr-52(P,n+alpha)reaction.
The error of the number of target
nuclei were 10% and 6.5% in proton irradiations
at the CV 28 and COSY injector, respectively.
-By Authors: Ti-45 can be induced by Cr-59(p,n+p+alpha)
reaction.  However, the difficulty of its exact
determination caused a relatively high uncertainty.
- By Compiler - Ti-45 production due to V-45 decay is
not included.
The error of the number of target
nuclei were 10% and 6.5% in proton irradiations
at the CV 28 and COSY injector, respectively.
